15. Magnetic Newton’s cradle

Repulsing, non-touching magnets are used instead of colliding balls to make a new type of Newton’s cradle. The new cradle can act in a similar way to a regular cradle, but can also exhibit other interesting behaviour. Explain and study the movement of this magnetic cradle.

Simulation Detail:

High Speed Drag Damping: $${D}\,=\,{\tfrac {1}{2}}\,\rho \,v^{2}\mathbb{C}_{d}\,A$$ where
\(\rho = 1.255\)
\(\mathbb{C}_{d} =1.28\)
\(v\) is the velocity
\(A\) is determined by diameter, which can be set in the simulation.

Stokes Law Damping: $${D}\,=\,-b\,v$$ where
\(b\) can be set in the simulation under Damping
\(v\) is the velocity

Euler Algorithm: Simulates 2000 times per second, each time calculating the current force and move the object

RK4 Algorithm: Simulate 2000 times per second, each time calculating 4 future force and position in order, then fit the result to produce the final result. This might be more accurate

Known issue:

  1. When using Total Energy in Euler Algorithm, due to unknown reason, the result might wobbles slightly, but it doesn't affect the big picture very much.
  2. When using Total Energy in RK4 Algorithm, due to unknown reason, the result might wobbles or decline slightly, but it doesn't affect the big picture very much.

Note:

  1. These simulation assumes that magnetic force are proportional to 1/r^2, which might not be very accurate comparing to real world situation. This is for reference only, further experiments are required.
  2. The plot can only save up to 500 seconds of data.
